alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 11:44AM CDT until April 21 at 6:51PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Minnesota, including the following counties, Kittson, Marshall and Polk. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM CDT, satellite estimates indicate Snow Melt. Rapid snowmelt is occurring and will continue to cause flooding. - Ongoing snowmelt will continue to lead to widespread flooding impacts throughout the next week. This may include road closures, washouts, and other snowmelt related flooding impacts. Precipitation may exacerbate these impacts.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
